title: 107_hr5106
content: The Alopecia Fairness Expansion Act of 2002 may be cited as such and includes a table of contents. The Alopecia Fairness Expansion Act of 2002 includes provisions for Medicare, Medicaid, SCHIP, FEHBP, Veterans, and TRICARE coverage of scalp hair prosthesis for individuals with alopecia areata-related hair loss. TRICARE and IHS now cover scalp hair prosthesis for individuals with alopecia areata-related hair loss. Medicare now covers scalp hair prosthesis for individuals with alopecia areata-related hair loss, effective July 1, 2003. "Medicaid now covers scalp hair prosthesis for individuals with alopecia areata-related hair loss." Medicaid now covers scalp hair prosthesis for individuals with alopecia areata-related hair loss, effective from July 1, 2003. The attending physician must certify in writing the medical necessity of the proposed treatment. Regulations for implementing amendments must be issued by a certain date. State plans for medical assistance under title XIX of the Social Security Act requiring State legislation to meet additional requirements imposed by the amendment will not be considered non-compliant solely for failing to meet this requirement before the first day of the first calendar quarter after the State legislature's session. Each year of a 2-year legislative session is considered a separate regular session. SCHIP will cover scalp hair prostheses for individuals with hair loss due to alopecia areata. The Social Security Act is amended to require coverage for scalp hair prosthesis for individuals with alopecia areata. The effective date for these amendments is on or after July 1, 2003. The State plan for medical assistance under title XIX of the Social Security Act may require State legislation to meet additional requirements imposed by amendments. Failure to meet these requirements before the first day of the first calendar quarter after the State legislature's session will not be considered non-compliance solely for that reason. If a State has a 2-year legislative session, each year is deemed a separate regular session. FEHBP will cover scalp hair prosthesis for individuals with hair loss from alopecia areata. FEHBP will cover scalp hair prosthesis for individuals with hair loss from alopecia areata, as long as the attending physician certifies the medical necessity. Coverage cannot have less favorable limits than other prosthesis coverage, with a plan potentially covering 80% of the costs. The amendment made by subsection (a) applies to items furnished on or after January 1, 2004. SEC. 6 and SEC. 7 address coverage of scalp hair prosthesis for individuals with hair loss due to alopecia areata under title 38 and TRICARE, respectively. The effective date for the amendment in SEC. 6 is October 1, 2002, while the amendment in SEC. 7 applies to items furnished on or after January 1, 2004. SEC. 8 amends the Indian Health Care Improvement Act to include coverage of scalp hair prosthesis for individuals with hair loss due to alopecia areata. Effective date is for items furnished on or after October 1, 2002. The Secretary will provide scalp hair prosthesis for Indians with hair loss from alopecia areata if medically necessary, effective January 1, 2003.
